body:
Whoops, gotta fix the tests.

@mythmon I rebased on master and tried to install the new bcrypt requirements and got:

```
Collecting cffi==1.5.2 (from -r requirements.txt (line 142))
  Downloading cffi-1.5.2-cp35-cp35m-macosx_10_10_x86_64.whl (151kB)
    100% |████████████████████████████████| 153kB 3.9MB/s
THESE PACKAGES DO NOT MATCH THE HASHES FROM THE REQUIREMENTS FILE. If you have updated the package versions, please update the hashes. Otherwise, examine the package contents carefully; someone may have tampered with them.
    cffi==1.5.2 from https://pypi.python.org/packages/cp35/c/cffi/cffi-1.5.2-cp35-cp35m-macosx_10_10_x86_64.whl#md5=4e247f933774b307d6ce257fbde6ce87 (from -r requirements.txt (line 142)):
        Expected sha256 9aee43865a42243555394d8090eaf97a0c9e0fc5ddc3344fce5a34b17f4b8c94
        Expected     or 96ca8beab869c2a0164b3ec9716dc85713a8e8b480e8d303520e6869dec27216
        Expected     or da9bde99872e46f7bb5cff40a9b1cc08406765efafb583c704de108b6cb821dd
             Got        810c52902a8a8ebdf37c3097930de1e51f0a70167444faa91f426228bc3f5277
```

Presumably this has something to do with your recent hashin patch. We probably don't have the hash for the OSX 10.10 wheel for cffi. Thoughts? Is this something we should just manually fix now or did we run hashin wrongly?
